00046 namespace luabind { namespace detail

00048 
00049         LUABIND_API std::string stack_content_by_name(lua_State* L, int start_index);
00050 
00051         struct class_registration;
00052 
00053         struct conversion_storage;
00054 
00055         // This function is used as a tag to identify "properties".
00056         LUABIND_API int property_tag(lua_State*);
00057 
00058         // this is class-specific information, poor man's vtable
00059         // this is allocated statically (removed by the compiler)
00060         // a pointer to this structure is stored in the lua tables'
00061         // metatable with the name __classrep
00062         // it is used when matching parameters to function calls
00063         // to determine possible implicit casts
00064         // it is also used when finding the best match for overloaded
00065         // methods
00066 
00067     class cast_graph;
00068     class class_id_map;
00069 
00070         class LUABIND_API class_rep
00071         {
00072         friend struct class_registration;
00073         friend int super_callback(lua_State*);
00074 //TODO: avoid the lua-prefix
00075         friend int lua_class_gettable(lua_State*);
00076         friend int lua_class_settable(lua_State*);
00077         friend int static_class_gettable(lua_State*);
00078         public:
00079 
00080                 enum class_type
00081                 {
00082                         cpp_class = 0,
00083                         lua_class = 1
00084                 };
00085 
00086                 // EXPECTS THE TOP VALUE ON THE LUA STACK TO
00087                 // BE THE USER DATA WHERE THIS CLASS IS BEING
00088                 // INSTANTIATED!
00089                 class_rep(type_id const& type
00090                         , const char* name
00091                         , lua_State* L
00092         );
00093 
00094                 // used when creating a lua class
00095                 // EXPECTS THE TOP VALUE ON THE LUA STACK TO
00096                 // BE THE USER DATA WHERE THIS CLASS IS BEING
00097                 // INSTANTIATED!
00098                 class_rep(lua_State* L, const char* name);
00099 
00100                 ~class_rep();
00101 
00102                 std::pair<void*,void*> allocate(lua_State* L) const;
00103 
00104                 // this is called as metamethod __call on the class_rep.
00105                 static int constructor_dispatcher(lua_State* L);
00106 
00107                 struct base_info
00108                 {
00109                         int pointer_offset; // the offset added to the pointer to obtain a basepointer (due to multiple-inheritance)
00110                         class_rep* base;
00111                 };
00112 
00113                 void add_base_class(const base_info& binfo);
00114 
00115                 const std::vector<base_info>& bases() const throw() { return m_bases; }
00116 
00117                 void set_type(type_id const& t) { m_type = t; }
00118                 type_id const& type() const throw() { return m_type; }
00119 
00120                 const char* name() const throw() { return m_name; }
00121 
00122                 // the lua reference to the metatable for this class' instances
00123                 int metatable_ref() const throw() { return m_instance_metatable; }
00124 
00125                 void get_table(lua_State* L) const { m_table.push(L); }
00126                 void get_default_table(lua_State* L) const { m_default_table.push(L); }
00127 
00128                 class_type get_class_type() const { return m_class_type; }
00129 
00130                 void add_static_constant(const char* name, int val);
00131 
00132                 static int super_callback(lua_State* L);
00133 
00134                 static int lua_settable_dispatcher(lua_State* L);
00135 
00136                 // called from the metamethod for __index
00137                 // obj is the object pointer
00138                 static int static_class_gettable(lua_State* L);
00139 
00140                 bool has_operator_in_lua(lua_State*, int id);
00141 
00142         cast_graph const& casts() const
00143         {
00144             return *m_casts;
00145         }
00146 
00147         class_id_map const& classes() const
00148         {
00149             return *m_classes;
00150         }
00151 
00152         private:
00153 
00154                 void cache_operators(lua_State*);
00155 
00156                 // this is a pointer to the type_info structure for
00157                 // this type
00158                 // warning: this may be a problem when using dll:s, since
00159                 // typeid() may actually return different pointers for the same
00160                 // type.
00161                 type_id m_type;
00162 
00163                 // a list of info for every class this class derives from
00164                 // the information stored here is sufficient to do
00165                 // type casts to the base classes
00166                 std::vector<base_info> m_bases;
00167 
00168                 // the class' name (as given when registered to lua with class_)
00169                 const char* m_name;
00170 
00171                 // a reference to this structure itself. Since this struct
00172                 // is kept inside lua (to let lua collect it when lua_close()
00173                 // is called) we need to lock it to prevent collection.
00174                 // the actual reference is not currently used.
00175                 detail::lua_reference m_self_ref;
00176 
00177                 // this should always be used when accessing
00178                 // members in instances of a class.
00179                 // this table contains c closures for all
00180                 // member functions in this class, they
00181                 // may point to both static and virtual functions
00182                 handle m_table;
00183 
00184                 // this table contains default implementations of the
00185                 // virtual functions in m_table.
00186                 handle m_default_table;
00187 
00188                 // the type of this class.. determines if it's written in c++ or lua
00189                 class_type m_class_type;
00190 
00191                 // this is a lua reference that points to the lua table
00192                 // that is to be used as meta table for all instances
00193                 // of this class.
00194                 int m_instance_metatable;
00195 
00196                 std::map<const char*, int, ltstr> m_static_constants;
00197 
00198                 // the first time an operator is invoked
00199                 // we check the associated lua table
00200                 // and cache the result
00201                 int m_operator_cache;
00202 
00203         cast_graph* m_casts;
00204         class_id_map* m_classes;
00205         };
00206 
00207         bool is_class_rep(lua_State* L, int index);
00208 
00209 }}
